Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo

Class EnemyPlane

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.image.ImageView
com.example.demo.ActiveActor
com.example.demo.ActiveActorDestructible
com.example.demo.FighterPlane
com.example.demo.EnemyPlane
All Implemented Interfaces:
Destructible, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class EnemyPlane extends FighterPlane
class extending fighterplane. enemy which spawns in level one and level two two. fires enemyprojectile.java.

  • Constructor Details

    • EnemyPlane

      public EnemyPlane(double initialXPos, double initialYPos, double spawnPositionY)
      initializes values by passing to superclass and has a random spawn position in the scene as well as an initial spawn on top or below the visible screen
      Parameters:
      initialXPos - initial x position for image view to place its image relative to the scene.
      initialYPos - initial y position for image view to place its image relative to the scene.
      spawnPositionY - actual y position for spawn of plane. passed as initial y position to superclass.

  • Method Details

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition()
      function which updates the current position of the plane. the pattern that the plane goes is as follows: 0. plane spawns either at the top or bottom of the viewable stage. 1. the plane will continue to move horizontally for a random time between 0 and 200 frames. 2. once the time the plane has been alive surpasses its entry time, the plane calls enterstage() function from its respective inital position. 3. after reaching its supposed position it will continue to move horizontally until its time alive surpasses its exit time (100 frames after entry time). 4. the exit stage function is called and the plane exits the viewable scene
      Specified by:
      updatePosition in class ActiveActorDestructible

    • fireProjectile

      public ActiveActorDestructible fireProjectile()
      function used to fire an enemyprojectile.java when its probability allows it to.
      Specified by:
      fireProjectile in class FighterPlane
      Returns:
      a projectile of type enemyprojectile.java, spawns at its offset values to the plane.

    • updateActor

      public void updateActor()
      function called by LevelParent.java to update position of actor.
      Specified by:
      updateActor in class ActiveActorDestructible

    • notAtPosition

      private boolean notAtPosition(boolean isTop)
      boolean which returns whether the plane initially spawned on top or below the screen. used for enterstage() and exitstage() function to correctly move the plane.
      Parameters:
      isTop - determines whether it spawns on top or bottom of the screen.
      Returns:
      boolean determining if a plane is at its entry position yet or not.

    • enterStage

      private void enterStage(boolean isTop)
      entry movement following initial spawn and wait. changes depending on whether it spawned on top or the bottom of the screen. enters rapidly while decelerating constantly until constantly moving into position.
      Parameters:
      isTop - determines whether it spawns on top or bottom of the screen.

    • exitStage

      private void exitStage(boolean isTop)
      exit movement following its exit time pass requirement. changes depending on whether it spawned on top or the bottom of the screen. slowly moves vertically while constantly accelerating to its maximum velocity and exiting the visible screen.
      Parameters:
      isTop - determines whether it spawns on top or bottom of the screen.

    • getPositionY

      private double getPositionY()
      returns the current y position of the plane. used in various calculations for movement, entry and exit phase.
      Returns:
      current y position of plane relative to the scene.
